heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 13 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.3°C) and outside temperature (down 1.8°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 141 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 3558 lux) and cloud levels (up 277 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 140.6m lower than yesterday, 81.3m higher than the past week, 277.0m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1039m to a maximum of 2260m, averaging 1325.7m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1244.4m and 1602.7m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, pleasant humidity levels and light winds will prevail. Drizzle or light rain possible, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
